meanings.definition: A person who speaks or behaves in a sarcastic or mocking manner.
meanings.sent1: The wisenheimer in class always made snarky comments during the teacher's lecture.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a wisenheimer and make fun of others just to feel superior.
meanings.sent3: The wisenheimer at the party thought he was the funniest person in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was such a wisenheimer, always teasing her about everything.
meanings.sent5: The wisenheimer's constant sarcasm made it hard for others to take him seriously.

meanings.definition: To act in a smart-alecky or know-it-all way.
meanings.sent1: Stop wisenheimering and just listen to what I'm saying!
meanings.sent2: He tends to wisenheimer whenever someone asks a question he thinks is too easy.
meanings.sent3: She wisenheimers her way through conversations, thinking she knows everything.
meanings.sent4: The child wisenheimers about dinosaurs, pretending to be an expert.
meanings.sent5: When you wisenheimer, people might not take you seriously.
